ESP800.name: Principles of Environmental Science and Policy
ESP800.description: Scholarship and research in environmental science and policy.

ESP801.name: Physical, Chemical, and Biological Processes of the Environment
ESP801.description: Interdisciplinary concepts in the natural sciences related to environmental problems. Ecology and human health.

ESP802.name: Human Systems and Environment
ESP802.description: Anthropological, economic, geographical, legal, political, and sociological concepts of human systems and environmental change.

ESP803.name: Human and Ecological Health Assessment and Management
ESP803.description: Concepts and techniques used to evaluate human and ecological health impacts from anthropogenic activities. Policy formulation and management strategies to mitigate health effects.

ESP804.name: Environmental Applications and Analysis
ESP804.description: Global, regional, and local environmental issues. Systems approach to identify and solve environmental problems.
ESP804.prerequisite: ESP 801 and (ESP 802 or concurrently) and ESP 803 or approval of department

ESP836.name: Modeling Natural Resource Systems
ESP836.description: System dynamics modeling in human-environment systems. Sustainability applications, including renewable and non-renewable resource use, greenhouse gas emissions and climate change, pollutants and limits to growth.

ESP845.name: Environmental Risk Perception and Decision-Making
ESP845.description: Theoretical underpinnings of individual decision-making and risk perception processes. Case studies of the interplay of risk perception and decision-making in an environmental and or criminological context.
ESP845.restrictions: Open to master's students or doctoral students in the School of Criminal Justice or in the Department of Fisheries and Wildlife or approval of school.

ESP846.name: Corporate Environmental Crime and Risk
ESP846.description: Theoretical accounts and multiple interventions relevant to corporate environmental crime and risk. Use of “Smart Regulation” principles to design interventions to match specific problems.
ESP846.restrictions: Open to master's students or doctoral students in the Department of Fisheries and Wildlife or in the School of Criminal Justice or approval of school.

ESP847.name: Global Risks, Conservation, and Criminology
ESP847.description: Theories, actors, characteristics and legal instruments associated with risk, conservation, and criminology related to globalization. Current case studies in criminological conservation.
ESP847.restrictions: Open to graduate students or approval of school.

ESP850.name: Introduction to Environmental and Social Systems Modeling
ESP850.description: Theoretical background of diverse modeling problems in complex environmental systems. Diverse modeling approaches to most appropriate modeling tools in a variety of contexts.

ESP869.name: Agent-Based Modeling
ESP869.description: Theoretical concepts related to simulating dynamic geographic phenomena in the intersection between human and natural systems. Innovative agent-based methodology applied to complex social-environmental systems. Hands-on experience of agent-based modeling, with special emphasis on modeling human decision-making and its impact on the natural environment.

ESP883.name: Multi-Equation Quantitative Models
ESP883.prerequisite: SOC 881 and SOC 882 or approval of department
ESP883.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Sociology and open to graduate students in the Environmental Science and Policy Specialization or approval of department.

ESP890.name: Modeling Environmental and Social Systems
ESP890.description: Modeling project of real-world environmental problems. Theories and methodologies from previous modeling courses to practical policy problems. Applied project with a variety of modeling tools and a trans-disciplinary synthesis. Model development, implementation, and evaluation in student groups.

ESP891.name: Selected Topics in Environmental Science and Policy
ESP891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ESP891.description: In-depth study of selected environmental science and policy issues.
